reviewText:
Chicken Invaders 3 is a hidden gem within the often scrap-yard like environment of the steam store. Although not many people know of this game I must say it is a good game, even if it is a blunt copy of a classic game.
Although many may complain about this I think it is a good thing as it already starts it at a good level.
The humour in this game truly makes it worth a buy even if it is just egg jokes or should I say egg yolks?!

By far the hardest of the Chicken Invaders trilogy on Steam (CI3,4,5). As someone who gets frustrated easily, i find this title a little beyond acceptable in the sadism stakes. I'll explain why.\nIn most of the traditional top-down or bullet-hell shooters i've played there is a pattern to foes, there are gaps between projectiles, there are tactics to be learned, there is timing to be practiced. Chicken Invaders 3 keeps up with these traditions for the most part, but is ruined by a handful of levels which throw these features out of the window. You can be having the best run of your life, having practiced and learned the movements of foes and general projectile release ideas and filled in the rest with your own reactions and nous. Then you reach a level called Chicken Square Dance" or "Chicken Geometry" which are completely random and invade all possible safe-spaces without any measurable consistancies or rotas. It's not projectiles that get in the way
date:
it's the foes themselves you'll get wiped-out by.
It's REALLY annoying.

The end-zone bosses are more imaginative than in CI5
recommended: but the keyboard repetition sensor is not as good as in either of the two sequels so you can't fire as quickly in this game
hoursPlayed: also the weapons overheat a lot more easily.\n\nDo i recommend it? Hmmmm. It's not as good as CI4; that game is this series' peak
voteText: but i do think CI3 is better than CI5 (which i gave a thumbs-down to). Yes
helpfulPercent: i would recommend it but only as an introduction to the series or for those who like their shooters to be bordering on unfair. But seriously
